title: 2004년 David Dill, Jr. v. Arnold Holt 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: David Dill, Jr. v. Arnold Holt. 판결일: 2004-06-03. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: David DILL, Jr., Petitioner-Appellant, v. Arnold HOLT, Warden, Attorney General of Alabama, State of Alabama Board of Pardons and Paroles, Respondents-Appellees
**판결일**: 2004-06-03
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Carnes, Cudahy, Dubina

## 변호인

Robert M. Illman and Christine A. Freeman, Fed. Pub. Defenders, Jennifer Anne Hart, Montgomery, AL, for Petitioner-Appellant., Steven M. Simon and Hugh Davis, Ala. Bd. of Parole & Pardons, Montgomery, AL, for Respondents-Appellees.

## 인용

- 371 F.3d 1301

## 판결문 요약

371 F.3d 1301
    David DILL, Jr., Petitioner-Appellant,v.Arnold HOLT, Warden, Attorney General of Alabama, State of Alabama Board of Pardons and Paroles, Respondents-Appellees.
    No. 03-10994.
    United States Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit.
    June 3, 2004.
    
      Robert M. Illman and Christine A. Freeman, Fed. Pub. Defenders, Jennifer Anne Hart, Montgomery, AL, for Petitioner-Appellant.
      Steven M. Simon and Hugh Davis, Ala. Bd. of Parole & Pardons, Montgomery, AL, for Respondents-Appellees.
      Appeal from the United States District Court for the Middle District of Alabama.
      Before DUBINA, CARNES and CUDAHY*, Circuit Judges.
      CARNES, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      David Dill, Jr., an Alabama prisoner, was convicted in an Alabama state court of murder and sentenced to life in prison. He was released on parole after fifteen years. After he allegedly committed two misdemeanors, his parole was revoked and his life sentence reimposed. Unhappy with his return to prison, Dill filed in the district court a petition for writ of habeas corpus pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 2241, alleging that the Alabama Board of Pardons and Paroles had revoked his parole without affording him due process of law. The district court dismissed his petition for failure to exhaust state court remedies as required by 28 U.S.C. § 2254.1
    
    
      2
      We granted Dill a certificate of appealability on the following two issues: (1) whether a state prisone...
